belonging or relating to the group of Jews who came from Spain or Portugal, or North Africa: He was a very important figure in the Sephardi Jewish community. Sephardi food includes an exotic array of tastes. Synonym
SephardicCompare
Ashkenazi
More examplesFewer examplesLadino is a variant of medieval Spanish, intermixed with Hebrew and is spoken by many Sephardi Jews. In the Sephardi community, boys wear a tallit from bar mitzvah age.He is Sephardi, but without familial memory of Europe.
someone who belongs to the group of Jews who came from Spain or Portugal, or North Africa : Some Sefardim do not mix fish and dairy. Compare
Ashkenazi
More examplesFewer examplesToday most Jews are the descendants of either the Ashkenazim or the Sephardim, each with their marked cultural differences.Most of the Sephardim arrived after the peninsula fell under Roman control in the second century BC.
